lesson_objectives: • In this lesson, you'll learn about the files that are created in a vanilla Hello World project. You will also be introduced to 3 apps that we will write in this unit: Hello Button, Tic Tac Toe (both together in the videos), and LightsOut (the lab)
• In this lesson, you'll learn about making UIs from a specification, including layouts and string and color resources.
• This lesson teaches you how to use button's onClickListeners, and you'll learn how to capture views from the layout, and strings and colors from your resource files.

lesson_title: MVC and Tic Tac Toe Model
lesson_objectives: • This lesson is about the Model-View-Controller design pattern and how Android supports it. We look briefly at a model for a TicTacToe game.
• More practice creating UIs to specification. Introducing TableLayouts.
• In this lesson, you'll learn how to respond when listing to multiple buttons.

• The lab specification is here.
  • When done, be sure to submit your zipped project, plus video demos if you are taking this in summer, to the Moodle dropbox.
  • Then go complete the Moodle 'Buttons and MVC' self-evaluation survey before calling it a day.
